actions.committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Executive Comment Requested from OMB and OPM.

committees.committee: House Post Office and Civil Service

official_title: To provide for a 20 percent pay increase for offices and positions covered by section 225 of the Federal Salary Act of 1967 (other than Members of Congress), and to provide that a study be conducted to determine whether appropriate pay relationships exist between the Senior Executive Service and the 3 highest grades of the General Schedule.

summary.text: Provides for a pay increase for Federal officials and judges. Directs the Office of Personnel Management to report to the Congress on a study of the pay relationships between the three highest grades of the General Schedule and the Senior Executive Service.

titles.title: To provide for a 20 percent pay increase for offices and positions covered by section 225 of the Federal Salary Act of 1967 (other than Members of Congress), and to provide that a study be conducted to determine whether appropriate pay relationships exist between the Senior Executive Service and the 3 highest grades of the General Schedule.
